lanalytics
  • Reference

Read file exported from Learning Catalytics

This function receives as input a learning catalytics *csv* file and parse it to create a long format data frame.

read_lc(quiz_dir)
  This function only receives as input the directory where all the quizzes files are stored.

Examples

  file_to_read <- "../../datasets/Dataset1/Quiz3_session12098.csv"
  head(read_lc(file_to_read))
#> Parsed with column specification:
#> cols(
#>   .default = col_integer(),
#>   `Email address` = col_character(),
#>   `student ID` = col_character(),
#>   `Last name` = col_character(),
#>   `First name` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 2 (round 1) response` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 3 (round 1) response` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 11 (round 1) response` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 2 (round 1) score` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 1 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 2 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 3 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 4 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 5 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 6 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 7 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 8 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 9 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 10 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 11 (round 1) responded at` = col_character(),
#>   `Question 12 (round 1) responded at` = col_character()

#> )
#> See spec(...) for full column specifications.
